body:
### Description of the Change

[String.prototype.substr()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/substr) is deprecated so we replace it with [String.prototype.slice()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/slice) which works similarily but isn't deprecated.
.substr() probably isn't going away anytime soon but the change is trivial so it doesn't hurt to do it.

### Alternate Designs

It would also be possible to use `substring()` instead of `slice()`

### Why should this be in core?

Best to not use deprecated functions

### Benefits

No more deprecated functions

### Possible Drawbacks

None

### Applicable issues

None so far

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/47576309/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/47576309)

Coverage remained the same at 94.465% when pulling **9ba2168e4fa2dc921107228ef1c689370162d2d6 on CommanderRoot:fix/rm-deprecated-substr** into **d7f6ea5f5d8406204053618c708634dbf5aa9670 on mochajs:master**.
